questions.text: For what newspaper did Greg Brock write?
questions.explanation:
The New York Times.

	CJ went to talk to "New York Times" reporter Greg Brock about the FCC story. Greg didn't want to write about the FCC story because he wanted to write about the Brussels trip.

questions.text: Was the gift that the president gave Josh for his work on the free trade agreement ever revealed?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	When Josh was talking to the lobbyist for the first time in his office, one of the mentioned the bottle of wine setting on his desk. This was the gift the president was talking about at the beginning of the episode.

questions.text: Where did Josh tell Leo his suit had been made?
questions.explanation:
Mexico.

	Josh and Leo were talking about the jobs that 17,000 jobs that were going to India instead of staying in the United States. Josh wanted to fix what he thought was a mistake that he made so the 17,000 computer jobs would stay in the United States and not go to some other country.

questions.text: What did Josh tell the others that he did for the trade agreement?
options: Was a force to be reckoned with
questions.explanation:
Gave free combs.

	Josh showed up in the Oval Office to much praise, but with great humility he told everyone that all he did was give out free combs.

questions.text: Which Marx brother did Josh refer to Donna as when he was in the bullpen talking to Ryan?
questions.explanation:
Harpo.

	Donna wasn't talking to Josh because Josh wasn't letting her go to Brussels so when Donna came to see Ryan, Josh called her by the name Harpo because Harpo never spoke.

questions.text: When everyone chimed in on the President's economic answers, what did Leo say they were?
questions.explanation:
Incomprehensible.

	When the President tried to explain that he didn't need talking points to discuss the free-trade agreement, Charlie said his answers could get polysyllabic, CJ said they could get academic, and Leo said they were just incomprehensible.

questions.text: How did Josh come to like free trade?
options: When he was a kid he thought free trade meant something different
questions.explanation:
From working with Bartlet.

	Josh and Will were talking about when they first came to like the idea of free trade. Will said he liked the idea because liked a good drill bit. Josh said he started liking it when he came to work for President Bartlet because the president liked it.

questions.text: On his Ryan's last day as Josh's intern, who gave him a job?
questions.explanation:
Congressman McKenna.

	Josh found out that Ryan was the legislative director for Congressman McKenna while he was waiting on Congressman McKenna to arrive for a meeting in the Roosevelt room. Ryan ended up getting Congressman McKenna a seat on the plane to Brussels. Josh had to sit with the press.

questions.text: Donna went on the Brussel's trip with Josh.
questions.explanation:
False.

	When Josh gave Donna a diplomatic passport, she thought it was for the Brussel's trip, but Josh told her that she was going on the CODEL with Fitzwallace and Andy.

questions.text: Who told Ben that CJ was 'just nuts for you'?
questions.explanation:
Leo.

	CJ and Ben were in her office having a late lunch and discussing the different TV stations when Leo came in to talk her into dropping the FCC story. When Ben introduced himself, Leo told him that CJ was just nuts for him and CJ offered Ben to Leo.
